snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, in announcing the plan to deploy a Joint Special Operations Command unit to Iraq, was displaying a “bright, shiny toy” in the military arsenal, an official said.
abstract: News Analysis; Pentagon's decision to deploy special operations teams against Islamic State represents Pres Obama's effort to increase pressure on group without committing traditional ground forces; targeting of high-level enemy fighters resembles strategy used in Iraq; rushed announcement of proposal leaves officials scrambling to implement it.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, in announcing the plan to deploy a Joint Special Operations Command unit to Iraq, was displaying a “bright, shiny toy” in the military arsenal, an official said.

headline.main: U.S. Sees Elite Military Unit as Key to Bigger Push Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Elite Military Unit as Key to Bigger Push Against ISIS

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
